translated: To Tissa, the Lord of the Two-footed,
the Protector of the World, the One of Great Strength,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the flower-bed.
I was a Lord of the People,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Ekañjalika recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ekañjaliko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Ekañjalikattherassāpadānaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai ekañjalikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽ekañjalika therassa apadānam pañcama
translated: The Elder Ekañjalika’s Birth Story, the fifth.
